issue.title: Non-integer resolution values don't work with Fourier bases

content.new:
When providing a non-integer value for the number of elements when initializing a Fourier basis, Dedalus spits out the error that,

Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "nd_dust_model_2d.py", line 28, in <module>

    domain = de.Domain([x_basis, y_basis], grid_dtype=np.float64)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/src/dedalus/dedalus/core/domain.py", line 46, in __init__
    grid_dtype = basis.set_dtype(grid_dtype)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/src/dedalus/dedalus/core/basis.py", line 609, in set_dtype
    native_wavenumbers = np.roll(np.arange(-kmax, kmax+1), -kmax)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/lib/python3.4/site-packages/numpy/core/numeric.py", line 1294, in roll
    res = a.take(indexes, axis)

TypeError: Cannot cast array data from dtype('float64') to dtype('int64') according to the rule 'safe'
content.old:
When providing a non-integer value for the number of elements when initializing a Fourier basis, Dedalus spits out the error that,

Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "nd_dust_model_2d.py", line 28, in <module>

    domain = de.Domain([x_basis, y_basis], grid_dtype=np.float64)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/src/dedalus/dedalus/core/domain.py", line 46, in __init__
    grid_dtype = basis.set_dtype(grid_dtype)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/src/dedalus/dedalus/core/basis.py", line 609, in set_dtype
    native_wavenumbers = np.roll(np.arange(-kmax, kmax+1), -kmax)

  File "/usr/local/dedalus/lib/python3.4/site-packages/numpy/core/numeric.py", line 1294, in roll
    res = a.take(indexes, axis)

TypeError: Cannot cast array data from dtype('float64') to dtype('int64') according to the rule 'safe'

issue.title: Non-integer resolution values don't work with Fourier bases

message.raw: One good option might be to add type annotations to Dedalus to allow for recent type-checking tools, etc.
message.html: One good option might be to add type annotations to Dedalus to allow for recent type-checking tools, etc.
